statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
You need walking from vertex S to vertex T in a graph. If you remove one vertex which stops you from walking from S to T, that vertex we call as key vertex. Now you are given a directed graph, S and T, and you should tell us how many key vertexes are there in the graph.
Please notice that S and T are key vertexes and if S cannot walking to T by the directed edge in the initial graph then all vertexes becomes to key vertexes.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The input consists of multiply test cases. The first line of each test case contains two integers, n(0 <= n <= 100000), m(0 <= m <= 300000), which are the number of vertexes and the number of edge. Each of the next m lines consists of two integers, u, v(0 <= u, v < n; u != v), indicating there exists an edge from vertex u to vertex v. There might be multiple edges but no loops. The last line of each test case contains two integers, S, T(0 <= S, T < n, S != T).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Output the number of key vertexes in a single line for each test case.
